transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Resource Management

title.narrative: Involving the spanish long-distance fisheries in the conservation of the NW Atlantic nesting loggerhead population.

description.narrative: This project supports workshops for captains and crews of Spanish long line fisheries vessels, which are the most impactful fleet in the North Atlantic and Mediterranean for loggerhead bycatch. Captains and crews will be taught bycatch mitigation measures, safe handling, and release techniques for turtles. A website will be maintained to enable the rapid dissemination of information to scientists, fisherman and government policymakers in the Mediterranean region on bycatch issues and reduction measures.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

title.narrative: INVOLVING THE SPANISH LONG-DISTANCE FISHERIES IN THE.CONSERVATION OF THE NW ATLANTIC-NESTING LOGGERHEAD.POPULATION

description.narrative: The recipient will; 1. conduct port and on board outreach and training for improving bycatch data and safe release and handling of sea turtles: 2. conduct fishing in the Mediterranean to test and validate the "3D" bycatch risk zoning tool; 3. conduct pilot fish trials to assess risk of bycatch in the Atlantic areas; and 4. film fishing operations and training workshops for outreach and education purposes.

title.narrative: Education and Training to CITES Authorities in Central America and the Caribbean

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to counter wildlife trafficking in Central America and the Caribbean by capacity development in several countries of the region on the implementation of CITES. This will be done by facilitating the successful selection, mentorship, and graduation of students in a Masters Course on CITES. Key intended results include the graduation of a co- hort of students, and the subsequent strengthening of CITES Authorities in the region.Specific activities will include: (1) facilitating the successful selection, mentorship, and graduation of students on the mentioned Masters Course. A CITES expert will support all academic needs of the students, including contribution to the selection of students among the CITES authorities in the region, support during the in-person stage (11 weeks), support for selection of topics for Master theses and search for directors, and support during the theses elaboration until their completion. (2) coverage of all logistic needs of students: traveling from their countries to Spain and back, accommodation, maintenance, academic taxes, simultaneous interpretation English- Spanish, small economic support for thesis field work, health and accident insurance.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

title.narrative: Conservation of the Loggerhead Turtle in the Western Mediterranean: coordinated solutions for the bycatch reduction in the foraging population of the Comunidad Valenciana (Spain).

description.narrative: The recipient will 1. evaluate marine turtle bycatch in artisianal fisheries operating in ports of Valencia Province with onborard observers; 2. conduct a preliminary analysis of the maritime recreational fisheries in Valencia and promote proper care of captured sea turtles; 3. conduct sea turtle conservation awareness campaign in newpapers , with newsletters and other means; 4. Support the Turtle Gazette newspaper for fisherman with 4 publications annually; and 4. work with the 59 coastal municipalities of Valenica to advance conservation of the loggerhead relative to land and waste management effectiving coastal marine environments.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: Involving the Spanish long distance fishery in the conservation of the NW Atlantic and the.Mediterranean loggerhead turtle nesting populations

description.narrative: 1) conduct outreach and education with longline and other fishers; 2) conduct a 3 month survey in the Western Mediterranean to map turtle critical habitat and risk; and 3) conduct fishing trials in Atlantic and Mediterranean with LL vessels to test and validate the 3 d bycatch risk zoning tool and test new bycatch mitgation measures.

title.narrative: Conservation of the Loggerhead Turtle in the Western Mediterranean: coordinated solutions for the bycatch reduction in the foraging population of the Comunidad Valenciana (Spain)

description.narrative: The purpose and intent of this project is to work with Spanish gill net and trawl fishers to reduce mortality and injury to accidently captured sea turtles along the Spanish Mediterranean coast. Juvenile loggerheads from the U.S. nesting popualtion account for about half of loggerheads interacting with fisheries in the Western Meditteranean. Activities include: (1) continue evaluation of sea turtle bycatch in artisanal fisheries operating out of three Valencia community ports using on board observers; (2) continue analysis of maritime recreational fishing and sea turtle bycatch; (3) engage 22 fisherman associations to prepare a strategy for reduction of sea turtle bycatch from fishing vessels operating out of Valencia community ports; and (4) supporting awareness, education and outreach efforts directed towards fishing communities including publication of The Turtle Gazette, published with topics for fisherman practical interest as well as sea turtle conservation messaging.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: Conservation of the Loggerhead Turtle in the Western Mediterranean: coordinated solutions for the bycatch reduction in the foraging population of the Comunidad Valenciana (Spain)

description.narrative: (1) evaluate sea turtle bycatch in bottom trawl fisheries operating in the Gulf of Cadiz using questionairres and on board observers; (2) continue capcity building of artisanal, trawl and longline fishermen to reduce bycatch and increase sea turtle survival rates through safe handling techniques; (3) create a trinational network (Morocco, Portugal and Spain) to reduce the bycatch impact in the Gulf of Cadiz and Strait of Gibralta; and (4) support awareness, education and outreach efforts directed towards fishing communities including publication of The Turtle Gazette, published with topics for fisherman practical interest as well as sea turtle conservation messaging..

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: ASSESSMENT OF SEA TURTLE BY-CATCH IN TRAWLING FISHERIES FROM THE ADRIATIC SEA AND POST-INTERACTION MORTALITY DUE TO GAS EMBOLISM

description.narrative: This project aims at obtaining realistic data about the impact of by - catch in sea turtles in the adriatic sea and defining feasable mitigation measures.

title.narrative: CONSERVATION OF THE LOGGERHEAD TURTLE IN THE WESTERN MEDITERRANEAN: COORDINATED SOLUTIONS FOR THE BYCATCH REDUCTION IN THE FORAGING POPULATION OF THE COMUNIDAD VALENCIANA (SPAIN). 2021-2024

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to work with Spanish gill net and trawl fishers to reduce mortality and injury to accidently captured sea turtles along the Spanish Mediterranean coast. Activities include: 1. continue evaluation of sea turtle bycatch in artisanal fisheries operating out of three Valencia community ports using on board observers; 2. continue analysis of maritime recreational fishing and sea turtle bycatch; 3. engage 22 fisherman associations to prepare a strategy for reduction of sea turtle bycatch from fishing vessels operating out of Valencia community ports; and 4. supporting awareness, education and outreach efforts directed towards fishing communities including publication of The Turtle Gazette, published with topics for fisherman practical interest as well as sea turtle conservation messaging
